website_summaries.verdict: A well-built tent designed to last you for many years of warm-weather camping.
pros: Durable tent that stands up well to weather and extended use
Storage pockets and gear loft keep items out of the way
Comes with stakes and guy ropes
cons: Mesh walls help to encourage airflow, but make it unsuited to cold weather camping

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again, great tent for the $$
customer_reviews.text: Took this camping to a national park with the family recently; tent was great, plenty of room for 4 and their accessories. Setup was fast and the rain-fly kept out a popup shower that surprised us. Acadia National Park in summer is known for fog, so I was expecting a lot of moisture in the tent from condensation, but the airflow vents kept the interior dry. I'm happy I made this purchase, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sean O

customer_reviews.title: Why you should buy Alps
customer_reviews.text: My Boy Scout troop uses this specific Alps series. The scouts use the 3 man. The leaders use the 5 or 6 man. All are used monthly and have been (Some) up to 7 years now. Alps is solid! PERIOD!... My 5 man is god for my cott, my gear and room to change. If I were camping with my wife or another in the tent I would have preferred the 6 man Mermac. Easy set up, even for one man. Foot print not included but I would suggest you use one. No need for sealers in stitches, Alps makes a great tent.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: what a great tent
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with this tent. I use this tent monthly on Scout camp outs. It's very comfortable for me. My primary reason for buying this tent was the ceiling height. I'm a 6' guy and this a 6' high ceiling so it's very comfortable for me. Putting up and taking down is pretty easy as well. It's also tough. I had my tent blow away and roll across a field a couple of times (because I didn't stake it down) with a cot inside and there was no damage to the tent at all.
customer_reviews.author: Twins1022

customer_reviews.title: Tent Floors Leak
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this tent in May. Went camping up in the Rockies, and we had heavy rainstorms all weekend, and I was SO disappointed! All the FLOOR seams leaked water into the tent. My friend also purchased this same tent, and his seams leaked water into his tent as well. All our clothes and gear were soaking wet. Thank God we had some water-proof spray and had a couple hours of sun in order to apply it and let it dry. I love this tent, and ALPS Mountaineering seems like a nice company, but this product was very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent its actually fun to put up
customer_reviews.text: We had the tent up in about 10 minutes It goes up and your done. No sleeves to push your tent rods through . The tent seems to be built very well. Love this tent its actually fun to put up. One of the tent poles came apart when we took it out of the bag. we called for warranty explained we were going to a Jamboree and needed the tent poles to go. Alps mountaineering had the poles at our front door in 4 days. The warranty dept at alps was fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: This held up like it was supposed to but we ended up camping ...
customer_reviews.text: This held up like it was supposed to but we ended up camping on a very rainy and muddy weekend. I sprayed the tent with a water proof repellent beforehand but after the first day it did collect some water on the bottom which caused a lot of condensation and wetness inside. We had a tarp down under the tent also. Over all was a nice tent to have on a sunnier camping trip. We have only used it twice so I have no idea how it will hold up in the future.
customer_reviews.author: pittsburgh0328

customer_reviews.title: Works great and is the most waterproof tent I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is the most waterproof tent I've ever owned. The first time I used it was for a two day archery tournament. It rained so hard that night that you could feel the pools of water under the floor, but we stayed dry. I also used it for a 5-day camping trip to the Grand Canyon over Spring Break. It works fine for car camping, but would be impossible for back country hiking. There is also no way 5 people could sleep in the tent, unless some are children. I fit 4 adults, with a very narrow, 10 inch, walkway in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Jared H.

customer_reviews.title: Good tent
customer_reviews.text: we are pleased with this tent. We have not camped in the rain yet, so we can not comment on its weather ability. The zippers on the door and windows were very smooth. The clips, at least in first two uses, were a bit stiff, so we had to push fairly hard to get them onto the shock poles. That slowed down set-up. Of course, you want them firm enough not to come off, so it may be okay after a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: tent pole shattered at first use. tried to get ...
customer_reviews.text: tent pole shattered at first use. tried to get ahold of Alps Mountaineering; no response to email per their instructions on how to reach for a RMA# to return. In trying to reach them today, returns email address no longer receiving emails.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Pretty much a 3-season tent. I have used it in some pretty windy conditions and it didn't even hardly move. I like the fact that the rain fly goes almost to the ground, unlike a lot of them. This keeps bad weather out. However, you can still get a nice breeze on hot days. Again, great tent.
customer_reviews.author: Beamused

customer_reviews.title: After one Use
customer_reviews.text: Used the tent once so far. It was very quick & easy for just me to set up & take down. Like the design. Plenty of ventilation & room. Only two concerns: 1) the durability of the floor & 2) the light colored tent walls show dirt. I'll be careful to protect the tent floor & wipe down the tent walls.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Leivo

customer_reviews.title: Good tent, no service.
customer_reviews.text: Nice tent for the money. One reason I bought was the good customer service comments. However, two pockets for the fly overhead pole were sewn backwards. I emailed the company, got no reply. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Davy

customer_reviews.title: pretty good quality
customer_reviews.text: pretty good quality, this is the second ALPS tent I have owned and the second to tear (the rain fly) after 1 summer outside.
customer_reviews.author: D R

customer_reviews.title: Well made and solid, even in strong wind. ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made and solid, even in strong wind. No leaking. We used it as a two-person tent because we have plenty of room for a queen inflatable and all of our gear at one end of the tent.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lane

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice tent but I can tell from the zippers that ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice tent but I can tell from the zippers that it's a little flimsy. One of the hooks inside broke immediately after we put it up. Still a good tent for the price. Just wont last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda P.

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: I took this tent and my dog on a 3 month, 48 state 14,000 mile trip last summer. Not a single complaint.
customer_reviews.author: LIAM HOLT

customer_reviews.title: great inexpensive tent
customer_reviews.text: great inexpensive tent. easy to set up (2 minutes with two people). Seems durable. Used it 6 nights on 3 trips.
customer_reviews.author: Rohebuks

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, only problem I had is that one ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, only problem I had is that one of my poles cracked with a little wind. About to ask the Alps people for a replacement pole. Tent is room enough for me and I like the 2 doors on it.....
customer_reviews.author: marty marin

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for summer camping
customer_reviews.text: This tent has some nice features and some not so nice features. The two doors, large rainfly and quality of the tent and poles are great. Having a mesh in the lower side walls that can't be zipped up and a thin floor with seams does not lend itself to fall/spring camping in high elevations, using cots and even risking it in heavy rain situations.
customer_reviews.author: Sportsman 4j

customer_reviews.title: Nice inexpensive tent for dry weather
customer_reviews.text: Good in wind, but not so great in rain or blowing dust. This tent goes up very easily and has lots of space inside, but it definitely leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Good family tent.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good sturdy tent for simple camping trips. It is high quality and very easy to set up. Not extremely light or small when packed so it wouldn't be a great candidate for family backpack trips.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: ... for the first time this weekend and it was perfect! It rained pretty hard the first night and ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time this weekend and it was perfect! It rained pretty hard the first night and I stayed completely dry.
customer_reviews.author: Keri

customer_reviews.title: Holds up to wind better than we expected.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, fit 4 of us and our dog. We were on the gulf coast with strong winds, and it held up well once tied down with the guy lines on the rain fly.
customer_reviews.author: enoutside

customer_reviews.title: Well satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Have used this tent on several occasions. Am well satisfied with it. As advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Steve in Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Great tent size for my family of four
customer_reviews.text: Great tent size for my family of four. Has two doors which is pretty cool. Very easy and quick to set up. Seems to be of pretty good quality also. Can do setup alone, but easier when you have another person helping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tent.
customer_reviews.text: We have two cots, and can fit them both in comfortably, and still have plenty of extra space. I put this up by myself in less than 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: JanelA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent!
customer_reviews.text: By far, the best tent I have used. It handled admirably throughout rainy nights. However, I would not recommend these for colder weather.
customer_reviews.author: Sum_it

customer_reviews.title: Great tent. Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Easy to set up. Withstood a severe mid-Missouri thunderstorm on the first day I used it. Stayed very dry and kept the bugs at bay. My only minor nit pick is the zipper sometimes catches the fabric flap when opening/closing the doors. But its not a major issue.
customer_reviews.author: craig

customer_reviews.title: Big tent!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Spcacious, easy set up, vents well without the rain fly.
customer_reviews.author: quinn c mueller

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Went camping last weekend. Had rain and high wind. The tent held up excellent in the high wind gusts, over 50 mph. No precipitation inside. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent and excellent price
customer_reviews.text: Very roomy, quick set up. Excellent tent and excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: No-Hassle Spacious Tent
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! Squeezed 5 people in it, barely. Stood up to rain and wind just fine. So easy to set up and take down.
customer_reviews.author: E. Paul

customer_reviews.title: good not great
customer_reviews.text: great volume, construction is adequate, set up is fair, stability fair. Price good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. Love that it's tall. Spacious.
customer_reviews.author: Walter B.

customer_reviews.title: great tent for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I just used the tent for the first time this past weekend, it was easy to set up and had plenty of room for my family of 4,2 adults, 2 kids and our 70 lb.dog Plus our large duffel bag with clothes. The material is thicker than other tents I've had and really feels like a quality product. We're very happy with our purchase and if it continues to hold up as it did this weekend, I plan on making alps mountaineering my go-to brand for tents.
customer_reviews.author: brandon reese

customer_reviews.title: Shock Cord failed after one use.
customer_reviews.text: In short, purchased the tent in May 2015. Used it once in June without issue. Took it on a second trip in September and the shock-cord on one of the poles had failed (material snapped). I had to make a emergency field repair to make tent usable. This shouldn't happen after only one use. I will make an effort to contact the company to see if they will replace the failed pole. If they make a good faith effort, I will upgrade my review.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Byers

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for warmer weather
customer_reviews.text: Just finished my first camping trip with this tent. It's very easy to set up, roomy enough for an air mattress and the double doors are great for coming and going. My only complaint is that the tent has two half walls made of mesh which would be great for camping in warm temps, but where we were it was in the 30's at night and even with the rain fly on, it was freezing. Looking forward to using this for summer camping. It's a great tent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: cocamper

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping
customer_reviews.text: It fits 3 adults very comfortably. Nice and lightweight. First time camping and read the instructions and set it up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Shiva Razi

customer_reviews.title: The first 4 nights were great the tent was easy to set up and take ...
customer_reviews.text: We used this tent for a 7 day camping trip. The first 4 nights were great the tent was easy to set up and take down. We got rain on the 5th day and the floor became wet. Seems like the main floor seam was not sealed well enough. My recommendation would be to upgrade to the outfitter to get a better floor and bigger zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Badass
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Easy to set up and for $100 there's no better tent in this price range. I will give an update after field testing.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme Kaufmann-Tong

product_meta.title: ALPS Mountaineering Meramac 5-Person Tent
feature_bullets: Easy assembly with a free-standing, two-pole design and shock corded fiberglass poles
Polyester fly resists water and UV damage, while providing an awning over each door
Fully equipped with storage pockets, gear loft, steel stakes, guy ropes, two awning covered doorways, two zippered windows and large side mesh panels
The ALPS Mountaineering Meramac Tent is on our best sellers list; a perfect tent for your next adventure
Base Size: 8' x 10', Center Height: 72", Total Weight: 14 lbs. 10 oz. , Color: Sage/Rust
